algorithm_technique: Iterate through all pairs to check category similarity, count unique categories.
problem_summary_simple: Count how many distinct categories exist among n elements using a handler.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through elements, using `haveSameCategory` to group and count unique categories.
key_insights: The provided solution uses a brute-force approach by comparing every element with every other element.
A more efficient approach would involve using a Disjoint Set Union (DSU) data structure to group elements by category.
The constraints (n <= 100) suggest that O(n^2) might be acceptable, but DSU would offer O(n * alpha(n)) complexity.
